scripts.say: With the defeat of the Siren carrier, the enemy planes soon fell into disarray without their mastermind and became fodder for the heavy anti-air fire.
However, the surviving planes began to ascend out of reach of the anti-air guns, as if waiting for an opportunity to counterattack.
Amagi, we're running out of ammo! Please give the order to retreat!
What a terrifying strategy... sending consecutive airstrikes while we are unable to contest the airspace...
If we make it back to port, we have to think of some countermeasures... and develop new equipment to combat this threat... *cough* *cough*
Amagi suddenly began to cough laboriously.
Amagi, you-
Time is running out. We have got to get you out of...
Before she could finish her words, Amagi suddenly collapsed like a puppet with its strings cut.
Kaga sprung forth and caught her before she could fall.
Hey! Amagi! Pull yourself together!
Amagi!!
Sensing an opportunity, a Siren aircraft swooped down towards the disabled Amagi, screeching as a bomb emerged from its underside.
There was a flash, and then a terrible explosion-
Kaga clung tightly to Amagi, shielding her from the blast with her body. In an instant, her armor was split apart from the force of the explosion, her clothing in tatters.
*cough* ... You fool... why didn't you dodge...?
Heh. Don't underestimate the armor of a real battleship. You just behave yourself and let us tow you back to port-
BOOOOOM!!
Another bomb detonated above them. Though off its mark, the explosion caused a massive pillar of water to erupt near them.
...Gah! Persistent bastards!
Kaga turned to survey the fleet - battered, bruised, and running out of ammunition. As their anti-air fire dwindled, more and more bullets began to rain down around Kaga and Amagi.
At this rate, we're all going to be wiped out! What should I do?!
Amagi, surely you don't plan to lose here!
Just... a little more...
What? A little more what? Amagi!
The Sakura fleet, which had long prided its resplendent main batteries that towered towards the heavens, had no experience dealing with a carrier's relentless attacks.
You should never have come here... I alone should bear the consequences for my mistakes...
"When your resolve is weak, you risk not only your life but also the lives of your comrades."
Just when Kaga began to come to terms with what would be her humiliating end-
In a plume of smoke, a number of enemy aircraft began to careen out of control and fall from the sky.
*cough* *cough* Looks like... they made it in time...
A number of biplanes, emblazoned with the bright insignia of the Sakura Empire, rushed forth, splitting the dark skies.
Caught off guard, the Siren aircraft were mowed down until not a single one remained.
What... are these?
These are Houshou's... and the Sakura Empire's... first carrier-based aircraft.
As expected of Houshou, being able to master her aircraft at such a critical time...
But... how did they manage to find us?
Well, before this even began, I told Houshou... if a recon plane was lost, to immediately scramble her fighters in that direction...
We have to use every resource at our disposal... after all, we aren't the only ones with carriers... the Sirens too...
That's just like you, Amagi. You're not called the "Phantom of the Sakura Empire" for nothing.
I'll do as you said. I'll return to port and become the strongest sword of the Sakura Empire, able to cut down any foe.
So, just hold on a bit longer! Everyone, we're going home!
